title: Euclidean Geometry
description: Foundations of Euclidean geometry, finite geometries, congruence, similarities, polygonal regions, circles and spheres. Constructions, mensuration, the parallel postulate. Appropriate for prospective and in-service mathematics teachers. 4 lectures.
prerequisites: MATH 248 with a grade of C- or better or consent of instructor
recommended: MATH 300 or familiarity with dynamic geometry software
